Lamentations__05.1: Remember, O Lord, what is come upon us: consider and behold our reproach.
Lamentations__05.2: Our inheritance is turned to aliens: our houses to strangers.
Lamentations__05.3: We are become orphans without a father: our mothers are as widows.
Lamentations__05.4: We have drunk our water for money: we have bought our wood.
Lamentations__05.5: We were dragged by the necks, we were weary and no rest was given us.
Lamentations__05.6: We have given our hand to Egypt, and to the Assyrians, that we might be satisfied with bread.
Lamentations__05.7: Our fathers have sinned, and are not: and we have borne their iniquities.
Lamentations__05.8: Servants have ruled over us: there was none to redeem us out of their hand.
Lamentations__05.9: We fetched our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword in the desert.
Lamentations__05.10: Our skin was burnt as an oven, by reason of the violence of the famine.
Lamentations__05.11: They oppressed the women in Sion, and the virgins in the cities of Juda.
Lamentations__05.12: The princes were hanged up by their hand: they did not respect the persons of the ancient.
Lamentations__05.13: They abused the young men indecently: and the children fell under the wood.
Lamentations__05.14: The ancients have ceased from the gates: the young men from the choir of the singers.
Lamentations__05.15: The joy of our heart is ceased, our dancing is turned into mourning.
Lamentations__05.16: The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us, because we have sinned.
Lamentations__05.17: Therefore is our heart sorrowful, therefore are our eyes become dim,
Lamentations__05.18: For mount Sion, because it is destroyed, foxes have walked upon it.
Lamentations__05.19: But thou, O Lord, shalt remain for ever, thy throne from generation to generation.
Lamentations__05.20: Why wilt thou forget us for ever? why wilt thou forsake us for a long time?
Lamentations__05.21: Convert us, O Lord, to thee, and we shall be converted: renew our days, as from the beginning.
Lamentations__05.22: But thou hast utterly rejected us, thou art exceedingly angry against us.
